mods.abstract: The strong electron paramagnetic resonance (EPR) of polarized targets can be used to search for axions as dark matter candidates in the range of (1-100) GHz. Once the axions are absorbed they can provide the communications gate for spin thermal contact between different nuclei that were kept artificially at different temperatures.
